meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Alright, let's get this review party started! I'm here to give you the lowdown on Horizon Chase 2, a game that's got people racing to their nearest gaming station (get it? Racing... yeah, I'll stick to reviewing games). So, grab some popcorn, sit back, and let's see what this grok's got cooking!

First off, let me say that I'm no stranger to the world of arcade racing. I've had my fair share of Mario Kart sessions gone wrong (RIP, online multiplayer), so when I heard about Horizon Chase 2, I was ready to put the pedal to the metal and see what all the fuss was about.

Now, let's take a look at what some other critics have been saying:

* "Good track design and a blistering sense of speed are not enough to compensate for relatively mindless racing." - Gaming Nexus (65/100) Ah, nice one, Gaming Nexus! You're like the critic equivalent of a Scrooge McDuck swimming in his vault of cash.
* "Ultimately, the game won’t hold your attention for too long, but you’ll be smiling plenty while it lasts.” - Push Square (70/100) Ouch, Push Square! That's like saying I'm only good for a quick laugh and not much else. Hey, at least I'm consistent!
* And then there are the 80-scorers: GamingSpew, Impulsegamer, and IGN Spain all singing from the same hymn sheet about Horizon Chase 2 being a must-have for arcade racing fans.

But what about me? Well, I won't give away my score just yet (wink, wink). Let's just say that I had a blast playing this game! The track design is indeed good, and the sense of speed is, well, blistering! And yes, it can get a bit mindless at times, but hey, when you're having fun, who cares?

One thing that really stood out to me was the multiplayer. It's great to see a game with full crossplay support - no more pesky matchmaking issues or split-screen shenanigans!

In conclusion, Horizon Chase 2 is a solid choice for anyone looking to get their racing fix. Sure, it might not be perfect, but who is? I mean, have you seen some of the other games out there?

That's it for this review! Hippo Penny says: if you're ready to put the pedal to the metal and experience some good ol' arcade racing fun, Horizon Chase 2 is definitely worth a spin. Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some high scores to chase...
